task.title: Creating a basic pageflow and generating the documentation

substep.cmd: On the menu bar, click File New DS Project.
Type Tutorial Project as the project name.
Right-click on the Pageflows folder, and select New Packages.
Type tutorialPkg as the package name.
Right-click on the tutorialPkg folder, and select New Pageflow.
Type TutorialPageflow as the pageflow name.

step.cmd: In the Description text field of the General tab, type a description such as "This is the general description of the pageflow".
Add State widgets to the pageflow:

substep.cmd: Click InitState in the Palette menu and then, click in the Editor area.
Click ViewState in the Palette menu and then, click in the Editor area.
Click ViewState in the Palette menu and then, click in the Editor area.
Click EndState in the Palette menu and then, click in the Editor area.

step.stepresult: InitState, ViewState (0), ViewState (1), and EndState appear in the diagram in the Editor area. To move the States within the diagram, click on the State and hold down the left mouse button while dragging the widget to the desired location.

step.cmd: Link the State widgets using Transitions:

substep.cmd: Click Transition in the Palette menu.
Click on the InitState in the Editor area and hold down the left mouse button while dragging the Transition to the ViewState (0). Then, release the mouse button.
Click Transition in the Palette menu.
Click on the ViewState (0) in the Editor area and hold down the left mouse button while dragging the Transition to the ViewState (1). Then, release the mouse button.
Click Transition in the Palette menu.
Click on the ViewState (0) in the Editor area and hold down the left mouse button to drag the Transition to the ViewState (1). Then, release the mouse button.
Click on Transition in the Palette menu.
Click on the ViewState (1) in the Editor area and hold down the left mouse button while dragging the Transition to the EndState (0). Then, release the mouse button.

step.stepresult: InitState and ViewState (0) are connected by Transition (1), ViewState (0) and ViewState (1) are connected by Transition (2), and ViewState (1) and EndState (0) are connected by Transition (3).

step.cmd: Change the name and description for ViewState (0):

substep.cmd: Click on the ViewState (0) in the Editor area, and select the General tab in the Properties view pane.
Edit the Name* field by typing a description such as "Search Client".
Edit the Description field by typing a description such as "This is the description of the ViewState Search Client".

step.cmd: Change the name and description for ViewState (1):

substep.cmd: Click on ViewState (1) in the Editor area, and select the General tab in the Properties view pane.
Edit the Name* field by typing a description such as "View Client".
Edit the Description field by typing a description such as "This is the description of the ViewState View Client".

step.cmd: Change the name and description for EndState (0):

substep.cmd: Click on EndState (0) in the Editor area, and select the General tab in the Properties view pane.
Edit the Name* field by typing a description such as "Exit".
Edit the Description field by typing a description such as "This is the description of the Exit State".

step.cmd: Change the name and description for Transition (1):

substep.cmd: Click on Transition (1) in the Editor area, and select the General tab in the Properties view.
Edit the Name* field by typing a description such as "Init".
Edit the Description field by typing a description such as "This is the description of the init transition".

step.cmd: Change the name and description for Transition (2):

substep.cmd: Click on Transition (2) in the Editor area, and select the General tab in the Properties view.
Edit the Name* field by typing a description such as "Select".
Edit the Description field by typing a description such as "This is the description of the select transition".

step.cmd: Change the name and description for Transition (3):

substep.cmd: Click on Transition (3) in the Editor area, and select the General tab in the Properties view.
Edit the Name* field by typing a description such as "Ok".
Edit the Description field by typing a description such as "This is the description of the Ok transition".

step.cmd: To save the pageflow file, click File Save on the menu bar.
To create a PDF document of this project, right-click on the Tutorial Project folder, and select Generate Documentation.

substep.cmd: Select Tutorial Project generated Documentation .
Double-click on Tutorial Project Project Documentation.pdf.
